intro: Leucas discolor, commonly known as the white leucas, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pale blue or white, with a distinctive two-lipped structure typical of the mint family. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
